# Chord

# Chord

Represents a musical Chord - a number of notes with a specific pattern which can be played together to form a harmonic sound.

Kind: global class

  • Chord
    • new exports.Chord(attributes)
    • .fullName : String
    • .name : String
    • .octave : Number
    • .pitchIntervals : Array
    • .type ⇒ string | undefined
    • .pitchClassesString ⇒ string
    • .toString() ⇒ String
    • .transpose(interval) ⇒ Chord

# new exports.Chord(attributes)

Throws:

  • MissingInformation When not provided with root and either name or pattern
  • DataNotFound When called with name and the name cant be found in the
Param Type Description
attributes Object Object that contains some of the following keys:
[attributes.root] Note chords root note
[attributes.name] String the chords name(e.g 'M')
[attributes.pattern] Array the pattern to build the chord by pitch intervals(e.g [3, 7]

Example

const c = new Note({note: 'c'})
const C_Maj_by_pattern = new Chord({root:c, pattern: [4, 7]}) // new C major chord.
const C_min_by_name = new Chord({root:c, name: 'm'}) // new C minor chord.

# chord.fullName : String

Name of the chord.

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.name : String

Chord type representation.

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.octave : Number

Returns chord root octave.

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.pitchIntervals : Array

Array of the intervals from the root to each note in the chord(excluding the root)

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.type ⇒ string | undefined

Whether chord is major, minor or neither.

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.pitchClassesString ⇒ string

Returns a string of the chord notes pitch classes.

Kind: instance property of Chord

# chord.toString() ⇒ String

Returns a string of the chord's name.

Kind: instance method of Chord

# chord.transpose(interval) ⇒ Chord

Generates a new chord with the interval applied

Kind: instance method of Chord

Param Type Description
interval Number the interval to apply
